alert.note: Alert for Saint Croix; Saint John; Saint Thomas (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 19 at 8:20PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...There is an increasing risk of flooding across Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands early in the upcoming week... Showers and thunderstorms associated with an area of low pressure (AL90)...now located near the Windward Islands...are forecast to reach and spread across Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands starting late tomorrow (Sunday night) and stretching into the middle of the workweek. Numerous showers and isolated to scattered thunderstorms are expected to reach the U.S. Virgin Islands and eastern Puerto Rico beginning late Sunday night into early Monday morning, spreading across the rest of Puerto Rico by midday Monday. The potential for showers and thunderstorms will continue Monday night into Tuesday. The resulting rains will increase the risk for urban and small stream flooding as well as flash flooding, which could also lead to mudslides and rapid river rises. Based on the most recent guidance, the most likely period for scattered to widespread rains is Monday afternoon into Tuesday morning, with the areas most likely to receive the highest rainfall accumulations across eastern and southern sections of Puerto Rico. In these areas, there is the potential for rainfall totals to reach 4-6 inches with isolated higher amounts. Elsewhere across Puerto Rico and across the U.S. Virgin Islands, rainfall totals of 1-3 inches with isolated higher amounts are possible. This product will be updated as needed. Please, continue to monitor the progress of this feature, which based on the most recent tropical weather outlook, has a medium to high formation chance within the next 2-7 days.

area.areaDesc: Saint Croix; Saint John; Saint Thomas
